anime.description: The show takes place in a futuristic city, where science has greatly progressed. A race of aliens called the Jurals invade the Earth to steal its resources, and Ken Izumi must become the superhero Chargeman Ken to stop them. Source: Wikipedia Note: The order of the Episodes on the DVD Release were scrambled a lot. (See Japanese Wikipedia)

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: extrasensory perception
tag.description: Extrasensory perception (ESP), involves reception of information not gained through the recognized physical senses but sensed with the mind. The term was coined by Sir Richard Burton, and adopted by Duke University psychologist J. B. Rhine to denote psychic abilities such as telepathy and clairvoyance, and their trans-temporal operation as precognition or retrocognition. ESP is also sometimes casually referred to as a sixth sense, gut instinct or hunch, which are historical English idioms. The term implies acquisition of information by means external to the basic limiting assumptions of science, such as that organisms can only receive information from the past to the present. In Japanese usage the term is often misappropriated to refer to any supernatural, non-magical, super power. Users of such powers are called `esper` in Japanese. The term `esper` is not normally in use outside of Japan but is slowly being introduced due to its usage in anime and manga. In anime/manga the following powers, among others, are described as ESP: - telepathy - precognition - clairvoyance - retrocognition - remote viewing - aura reading - out-of-body experiences (OBE) - psychokinesis

tag.name: alien
tag.description: This entity or creature was born on another world than the main characters.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: gunfights
tag.description: Fights where two or more parties are firing guns at one another.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: Middle East
tag.description: The Middle East is a transcontinental region centered on Western Asia, Turkey (both Asian and European), and Egypt (which is mostly in North Africa). The corresponding adjective is Middle Eastern and the derived noun is Middle Easterner. The term has come into wider usage as a replacement of the term Near East (as opposed to the Far East) beginning in the early 20th century. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: world domination
tag.description: "Gee, Brain, what do you want to do tonight?" "The same thing we do every night, Pinky: try to take over the world!" A main objective for one of the characters is absolute control of not just one country, but a whole planet!

tag.name: superhero
tag.description: In modern popular fiction, a superhero is a type of costumed heroic character who possesses supernatural or superhuman powers and who is dedicated to fighting crime, protecting the public, and usually battling supervillains. A female superhero is sometimes called a superheroine. Fiction centered on such characters, especially in American comic books since the 1930s, is known as superhero fiction. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: bloodless wounds
tag.description: No matter what weapon is used in what way to attack, hurt or kill somebody, there won`t be blood. You may see ripped clothes and smoke coming from the deadly wounds, but that`s it. So if you have an aversion towards the red liquid but still love some action going on - this is the anime for you!

tag.name: kidnapping
tag.description: In criminal law, kidnapping is the taking away or transportation of a person against that person`s will, usually to hold the person in false imprisonment, a confinement without legal authority. This may be done for ransom or in furtherance of another crime, or in connection with a child custody dispute. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: air combat
tag.description: Dogfight refers to combat engagement between aircraft (or space craft), often one on one. So in short: jets, planes, missiles, machine guns and maybe a kamikaze or two. Not to be confused with the `bark-bark` or `woof-woof` sort of dogfight.

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: suicide
tag.description: One or several characters in this anime commit suicide.

tag.name: hostage situation
tag.description: One or more characters in this anime are taken hostage, to pressure or blackmail other involved parties. A person given as a pledge or security for the performance of the conditions of a treaty or stipulations of any kind, on the performance of which the person is to be released. (Source: Wiktionary)

tag.name: alien invasion
tag.description: An alien invasion or space invasion is the invasion of the Earth by an extraterrestrial species, usually but not necessarily sentient and highly advanced technologically. The invasion typically happens for reasons such as to exterminate and supplant human life, to enslave the earthlings or harvest them for food, to steal the planet`s resources, or simply to destroy it altogether. It often happens during, causes, or is the result of a war between humans and aliens.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: monster of the week
tag.description: On a pretty much regular basis — weekly or episodic — the protagonists engage in some kind of conflict. This can be an actual showdown between mecha, or the all-out fight against an enemy, or a (car) race that needs to be won. This can make the anime quite repetitive.

tag.name: brainwashing
tag.description: Brainwashing, the application of coercive techniques to change the values and beliefs, perceptions and judgements, and subsequent mindsets and behaviours of one or more people, usually for political, financial, personal, or religious purposes. Often features in dark anime or pornography.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: episodic
tag.description: An episodic anime consists of many successive short arcs that are generally 1-2 episodes in length, with strong plot continuity within each arc but generally little continuity from one arc to the next. For long shows (well upwards of 50 episodes), the episode count constraint is less tight; for example, a show with close to 250 episodes would also be considered episodic if it consisted of a majority of arcs of up to 3 or maybe 4 episodes and possibly also very few slightly longer arcs.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 勝利! チャージマン研
Victory! Chargeman Ken
Shouri! Chargeman Ken
episode.summary: After 64 episodes of continual defeats, the Juralians launch their mightiest and deadliest offensive. It`s time for Ken to settle things, once and for all! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 爆発! マンモスコントロールタワー
Explosion! The Mammoth Control Center
Bakuhatsu! Mammoth Control Tower
episode.summary: The cities of Earth depend on massive central control centers to function, and the Juralians are destroying them, one by one! Ken has to move fast, before civil order completely collapses. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 殺人ボクサーを倒せ!
Defeat the Murderous Boxer!
Satsujin Boxer o Taose!
episode.summary: A night at a prize fight ends in murder...and for once, it`s not by Ken! There are Juralians in the house, and Ken`s about to get on tonight`s fight card! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 農業コンビナートの危機
Crisis at the Agricultural Complex!
Nougyou Combinator no Kiki
episode.summary: The staff of a giant farm have vanished, and from that pile of charred corpses in the farm house, we can assume there`s been foul play! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バリカンの旧友が尋ねて来た
Barican`s Old Friend Pays a Visit
Barikan no Kyuuyuu ga Tazunete Kita
episode.summary: In a shocking twist, a robot shows up claiming to be Barican`s old friend, and everyone seems to love him! But, why can`t Barican recall ever having met this weirdo? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大津波の襲撃
Tsunami Attack
Daitsunami no Shuugeki
episode.summary: The Juralians have invented a tsunami weapon, and it`s dragged beachgoers down to a watery prison...including Ken`s family! Can he save them before they`re gassed to death? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖の森
Forest of Terror
Kyoufu no Mori
episode.summary: A couple of hunters learn that the only thing worse than getting on Ken`s bad side is stumbling upon a secret Juralian base in the middle of the woods. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 悪魔のサーカス団
Circus of Fiends
Akuma no Circus Dan
episode.summary: Ken, Caron, and Barican want to see the circus, but don`t have any money. Good thing that friendly clown decides to just let them in. Surely this won`t end in crowds fleeing in panic. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 南極遊園地
The Antarctic Amusement Park
Nankyoku Yuuenchi
episode.summary: Ken and his family take a fun trip to the Antarctic Amusement Park. As usual, the Juralians aren`t about to let anyone have any fun! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暴走! 馬上の研
Runaway! Horseback Ken
Bousou! Bajou no Ken
episode.summary: Ken is invited to try out horseback riding. As might be expected, this ends up with vehicular equus-cide. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エジプトで出会ったやつ
The Ones They Met in Egypt
Egypt de Deatta Yatsu
episode.summary: In a clear abuse of his hero powers, Ken and Barican take a joyride to Africa, crash in Egypt, and yet somehow still manage to run into Juralians. This is one of the very few episodes where the show seems self-aware. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怪奇! ろう人形館
Spooky! The Waxwork Museum
Kaiki! Rou Ningyou Kan
episode.summary: Stranger than the fact that waxworks are still a thing in 2074 is that the figures are coming to life at night and driving the watchman mad! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怪しい花嫁
The Suspicious Bride
Ayashii Hanayome
episode.summary: Marriage! A joyful occasion...unless your bride is an alien in disguise! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 海底油田を爆破しろ!
Blow Up the Undersea Oil Field!
Kaitei Yuden o Bakuha Shiro!
episode.summary: The Juralians have targeted an undersea oil field staffed by robots. Hurry, Ken! The oil must flow! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 捨て犬コロ
Stray Dog Koro
Sute Inu Koro
episode.summary: Ken and Caron adopt an old abandoned dog. Warning: this episode contains terrible dog abuse from psychotic children and dangerous aliens. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みなし子センターを救え!
Save the Orphan Center!
Minashiko Center o Sukue!
episode.summary: A rich benefactor seems to be adopting an awful lot of orphans, but none of his references check out. Maybe they should investigate them BEFORE handing over the orphans. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 不良少年の正体は!
The Delinquent`s True Colors!
Furyou Shounen no Shoutai wa!
episode.summary: Ken`s classmates are being bullied by a very dangerous juvenile delinquent. Somehow, this ends up with Ken in a bike race, fighting for his life. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 孤島の対決!
Showdown on the Solitary Island!
Kotou no Taiketsu!
episode.summary: Ken awakens on a desert island, captive to a Juralian disguised as an old woman. Worse, his voice is gone, and without it, he can`t transform! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジュラルの大逆襲
The Great Juralian Counterattack
Jural no Daigyakushuu
episode.summary: The Juralians aren`t fooling around anymore, and have decided to attack en masse. The king is certain that Chargeman Ken can`t possibly stop them. The king is clearly mistaken. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖! 白髪老婆の家
Terror! The House of the White-Haired Crone!
Kyoufu! Hakuhatsu Rouba no Ie
episode.summary: Apparently, parents in 2074 are totally cool with letting a bunch of 10-year-olds just ride off with the clothes on their back and stay in the homes of strange old ladies. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鳩時計が3時を指したら
When the Cuckoo Clock Strikes Three
Hatodokei ga 3ji o Sashitara
episode.summary: When the clock strikes three, it`s time for Caron to kill! This episode features a knife-wielding Caron, child abuse, and terrible piano playing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 研の偽者をやっつけろ!
Beat the Fake Ken!
Ken no Nisemono o Yattsukero!
episode.summary: Ken`s been out sick, and his teacher Miss Nagisa decides to pay a call. But something seems different about him... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カメラのファインダーを覗け!
Peer Through the Camera Viewfinder!
Camera no Finder o Nozoke!
episode.summary: Ken`s developed a sudden interest in kendo...and in the new assistant instructor at his dojo. He`s clearly a Juralian in disguise, but what`s he up to? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 空軍基地が狙われている!
The Air Force Base Is Targeted!
Kuugun Kichi ga Nerawarete Iru!
episode.summary: The Juralians need someone to penetrate a secure military base to allow them entry. Naturally, they once again force a child to help them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シンデレラの少女
Cinderella Girl
Cinderella no Shoujo
episode.summary: Yet another Dickensian child gets used by the Juralians in a plot to steal aircraft designs. This episode features a bag of bees and a girl who is clearly voiced by an adult man using a falsetto. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 疾走! 殺人ハイウェイ
Race on Murder Highway!
Shissou! Satsujin Highway
episode.summary: Another standout episode, featuring an interminably slow "race". Nobody ever seems to question this 10-year-old boy driving his 7-year-old sister around in a car. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 美人ロボットは殺しの使者
The Pretty Robot Is a Herald of Death
Bijin Robot wa Koroshi no Shisha
episode.summary: Mom and Caron are off to the beauty parlor. A beauty parlor...of death! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジュラルのニセ友情作戦
Operation Juralian Fake Friendship
Jural no Nise Yuujou Sakusen
episode.summary: A lonely rich boy wants to be friends with Ken. For some reason, Ken still can`t see that nobody wants to be his friend except for murderous Juralians. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハイジャックをやっつけろ!
Beat the Hijack!
Hijack o Yattsukero!
episode.summary: Ken and his family have the bad luck to pick a flight that gets hijacked. The hijackers have the bad luck to pick a flight filled with Juralians who are all there to kill Ken! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦慄! 悪魔の病院
Shudder! The Devil`s Hospital
Senritsu! Akuma no Byouin
episode.summary: In a genuinely horrifying move, the Juralians plot to poison pregnant women all over Japan to produce malformed babies. But Ken stands ready to deliver some blazing atomic justice! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 頭の中にダイナマイト
Dynamite in the Brain!
Atama no Naka ni Dynamite
episode.summary: If you see only one episode of Chargeman Ken, let it be this one. It has it all: technical incompetence, a bizarre alien plot, and Ken at his sociopathic worst. Please forgive him, Dr. Volga! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スカイロッド 地底に突っこめ!
Sky Rod, Burrow into the Earth`s Depths!
Skyrod Chitei ni Tsukkome!
episode.summary: The Juralians are trying to sabotage an underground industrial site in the remote mountains of Japan. This time, Ken will have to take Sky Rod underground to save the trapped workers! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 僕のパパは時代おくれ?
Is My Dad Old-fashioned?
Boku no Papa wa Jidai Okure?
episode.summary: Yes, Mamoru. Your dad is very old fashioned. This time around, the Juralians` sinister plan is...to help a man hang himself. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 金庫破りの名人
The Master Safe Cracker
Kinko Yaburi no Meijin
episode.summary: Sousuke Furuyama is a newly released convict who just wants to get back to his family and live an honest life. Too bad the Juralians have a need for his talents. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 危機! 爆破1秒前
Crisis! One Second to Blast
Kiki! Bakuha 1 Byou Mae
episode.summary: A human stadium owner is ready to sell out humanity to help the Juralians bomb it. Only a poor little mute girl who seems to have wandered in from another series entirely can warn Ken! Watch for an animation glitch at 2:46 where you can see the camera operator`s hands in the shot! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 塔上のキャロンを救え!
Save Caron from the Top of the Tower!
Toujou no Kyaron o Sukue!
episode.summary: In an obvious nod to King King, an ugly Juralian takes Caron hostage and climbs to the top of a tower with her. Ken is especially brutal in this one. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ファッションモデルを消せ!
Rub Out the Fashion Model!
Fassion Model o Kese!
episode.summary: A fashion model has seen something she shouldn`t, and now the Juralians are after her! This episode features some really precious "futuristic" fashion. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宇宙ロケットZ9号
Space Rocket Z9
Uchuu Rocket Z 9 Gou
episode.summary: A human scientist at a rocket factory is aiming to sell secret plans to the Juralians, but then he double crosses them! That...isn`t a smart thing to do, as he soon learns. Can Ken save him? Will Ken even want to save him? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 燃える毒きのこの家
The Burning Poison Mushroom House
Moeru Doku Kinoko no Ie
episode.summary: Ken`s classmates are acting strange, not paying attention in class and sneaking off to sample funny mushrooms. It`s like a classic afterschool special, only with a dose of alien murder! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 記憶を無くした少女
The Girl Who Lost Her Memory
Kioku o Nakushita Shoujo
episode.summary: Another pretty girl, another obvious Juralian trap. The eventual showdown in the amusement park is a series highlight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雄一少年を救え!
Save Young Yuuichi!
Yuuichi Shounen o Sukue!
episode.summary: Yuuichi is Ken`s classmate, and he`s taken to petty arson in response to his parents fighting all the time. But the Juralians want to use his fiery talents for something bigger... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ロボットクラブへの招待状
An Invitation to the Robot Club
Robot Club e no Shoutaijou
episode.summary: Barican is invited to join a secret robot club. A club that meets in the graveyard? Would anyone want to join a club that would have Barican as a member? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖! 精神病院
Mental Hospital Terror!
Kyoufu! Seishin Byouin
episode.summary: This episode is stunning in its portrayal of the mentally ill and probably couldn`t be rebroadcast in Japan today. Features a doctor who wants to blow up Europe. Not a country in Europe, just...Europe. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 時限爆弾電送テレビ
Time Bomb Fax TV
Jigen Bakudan Densou TV
episode.summary: The Juralians attack with the physical facsimile television, able to transmit weapons into vital Earth facilities. It`s up to Ken to save the day! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キャロンへの贈り物
Caron`s Present
Kyaron e no Okurimono
episode.summary: Caron gets a pretty doll from a secret admirer. But what sinister orders does it whisper to her as she sleeps? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガールフレンドが出来た
Ken Gets a Girlfriend
Girlfriend ga Dekita
episode.summary: Ken meets a pretty girl named Miyuki and is immediately smitten. And Barican doesn`t like that, at all! Nothing about this is remotely suspicious. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 銀行ギャング キャロンが危ない
Bank Gang: Caron`s in Danger!
Ginkou Gang Kyaron ga Abunai
episode.summary: Caron rollerskates straight into a bank robbery and is taken hostage. Then she`s captured by Juralians! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 囚人島大脱走
The Great Escape from Prison Island
Shuujin Tou Daidassou
episode.summary: The Juralians stir up a prisoner revolt and breakout from a giant prison. Can Ken somehow stop the Juralians without killing their human stooges? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 研の秘密を探れ!
Find Ken`s Secret!
Ken no Himitsu o Sagure!
episode.summary: The Juralians kidnap Dr. Yoshizaka to force the secret of Ken`s weakness from him. It turns out that Ken`s weakness is...losing his Alpha Gun! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 殺人レコード 恐怖のメロディー
Murder Record, Melody of Terror!
Satsujin Record Kyoufu no Melody
episode.summary: The Juralians unleash their most fiendish plot yet: a record of the show`s background music that sucks the life from the listeners! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 美術館の怪!
The Art Gallery Mystery!
Bijutsukan no Kai!
episode.summary: Ken`s class (Which apparently only goes on field trips) visits an art museum, but the students are vanishing. Could it be a Juralian plot? Could it be anything else? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇夜に消えた大仏
The Daibutsu That Vanished into the Night
Yamiyo ni Kieta Daibutsu
episode.summary: The Juralians bring the famous giant Buddha statue of Kamakura to life and set it on a rampage. The result is fantastically sacrilegious! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 対決! 海底都市
Showdown! The Undersea City
Taiketsu! Kaitei Toshi
episode.summary: Ken`s class is off on yet another field trip, this time to an undersea city. But this time, the alien menace is a duplicate of his teacher, Miss Nagisa! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 野菜サラダが食べられない
We Can`t Eat Vegetable Salad
Yasai Salad ga Taberarenai
episode.summary: Caron`s on a health kick, and the Juralians are destroying all the vegetables on Earth. It`s up to Ken to return vegetables to dinner plates everywhere, earning him the eternal scorn of every other child on Earth who isn`t Caron. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地球を守れ!
Save the Earth!
Chikyuu o Mamore!
episode.summary: A runaway planet is going to destroy Earth, which would be bad news for both the humans and the Juralians. The solution? Team up, for this one time only! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バリカン大暴れ!
Barican Runs Amuck!
Barikan Daiabare!
episode.summary: In a stunningly logical move, the Juralians capture Ken and his family and prepare to execute them. Their only hope? Barican. Note - At no point does Barican actually ever run amuck. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジュラルモンス登場
Enter, The Juralmons!
Jural Monsu Toujou
episode.summary: The Juralians create a robot kaiju to attack Earth ships. The episode is most notable for a fight between Ken and Barican that serves no purpose whatsoever. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジュラル星人X-6号
Juralian X-6
Jural Hoshijin X-6 Gou
episode.summary: After Ken saves a woman who turns out to be a Juralian spy, she finds she can`t bring herself to kill Ken! This won`t end well. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 西部の男・研!
Man of the West Ken!
Seibu no Otoko: Ken!
episode.summary: Ken, Caron, and Barican travel to a futuristic Old West theme park inhabited by killer robots who exist to be gunned down by the human guests. You might have caught the recent remake of this episode on HBO. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怪奇宇宙植物園
Uncanny! The Space Botanical Garden
Kaiki Uchuu Shokubetsu En
episode.summary: Ken and his class (with Caron and Barican tagging along) take a trip to the space botanical garden, filled with exotic alien plants. It would be a shame if they somehow came to life and began to attack, wouldn`t it? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖! ミイラが馬車でやってくる
Terror! The Mummy Comes by Carriage!
Kyoufu! Miira ga Basha de Yatte Kuru
episode.summary: Ken and his class take a trip to Hokkaido, where they`re attacked by a Juralian mummy riding in a horse drawn carriage. Good thing Ken never leaves home without his trusty Alpha Gun! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 謎の美少年
The Mysterious Handsome Boy
Nazo no Bishounen
episode.summary: A new student at Ken`s school has stolen every girl`s heart. So, why does he want to get Ken alone to show him his special secret? Absolutely nothing dirty happens in this episode. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蝶の大群が舞う
The Butterfly Swarm Flutters!
Chou no Taigun ga Mau
episode.summary: The Juralians have a cunning plan: killer butterflies that eat human cells! The solution to this problem will likely involve a lot of dead butterflies. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 危機一髪!!
Safe by a Hair!!!
Kikiippatsu!!
episode.summary: It`s Caron`s birthday, and the Juralians crash the party to challenge Chargeman Ken. For some reason, Ken accepts and walks into the obvious trap. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 危機!!! 子供宇宙ステーション
Danger!! The Children`s Space Station
Kiki!!! Kodomo Uchuu Station
episode.summary: Young Ken Izumi, his sister Caron, and their annoying robot sidekick Barican must save the local amusement park from the sinister Juralians. Watch for the scene where Ken rolls two feet off the ground, thanks to an animation error! Source: crunchyroll
